company: BANK OF NEW YORK MELLON CORP
name_glassdoor: BANK OF NEW YORK MELLON CORP
review_title: The grass may not be greener, but is your health and worth?
review_info: Feb 4, 2022 - AML Compliance Analyst in Oriskany, NY
pros: Good benefits for 401 comp match, vacation time and additional vacation week purchase, good sick pay hours, good disability coverage, good maternity coverage. They are remote right now so in that aspect they care about safety of employees.
cons: They do not pay enough for the job they expect. They change the title of your job to fit the pay they want to give, so that they can " claim " we are paid well within the area for a representative but that's not the job we do it is way more. Pile on the work, no solid tools to do the job they expect for the volumes. They claim to care about your health and wellness and give superficial class offerings, but the work volumes and demands are so high there is not enough time in the day to get it all done. Not to mention newer employees get bumps up due to get to the position requirements for pay per NYS, but the loyal employees over that bump with the skills get nothing extra. Company is making money no bonuses for all that are below high level mgr.
advice: This specific job can be done remote and is more efficient from home with volumes. Keep it remote and pay employees more for the real title of the job and then you will get people with quality experience coming to work for you.

company: BANK OF NEW YORK MELLON CORP
name_glassdoor: BANK OF NEW YORK MELLON CORP
review_title: Not the Company it Once Was, Sadly
pros:
Opportunities for hands-on experience at all levels (partly because they are so understaffed), often more than at similar companies.

Accountabilities expand on an ongoing basis, which can be good for one’s resume (but they won’t compensate you for it).
cons:
Revenue not growing so shareholder returns are coming largely from staff cuts, compensation cuts and benefit cuts. 

Culture has significantly degraded last few years. Policy is to rate 10 percent of employee Below Expectations and manage them out, and good managers who have built high-performing teams still have to find people to rate BE and to eliminate on a rolling basis. Think Lord of the Flies.

Bad behavior among EC tolerated to a much greater degree than it used to be or is in a good company. 

EC has become increasingly dysfunctional in recent years, with almost everyone using their jobs as stepping stones vs. building sustainable value for the company. EC member responsible for our group badmouthed most of his own people.

Long-time employees not presently valued, and most long careers there end on an ugly note.

HR poorly resourced and run. Former employees should expect to spend lots of time fighting for everything they’ve earned.
advice: Start caring about your employees again. You still have many terrific people who are working their backsides off. Don’t throw them away like you’ve been doing. It pains me to write this review but the company I once loved has become unrecognizable.

company: BANK OF NEW YORK MELLON CORP
name_glassdoor: BANK OF NEW YORK MELLON CORP
review_title: Great place to work if you are fresh out of college
review_info: Mar 21, 2022 - Tax Reporting Specialist in Syracuse, NY
pros: The work can be tedious but it is great for someone who wants to amp their data analysis and teamwork skills in a regulated tax department. Benefits are excellent. They offer tuition reimbursement. You get to work tax season (Jan-Mid-March) and are paid overtime for working over 40 hours a week.
cons: Working remotely has been an adjustment, but can work well in the environment. Tech issues tend to happen on occasion and not having face to face communication with your coworkers has been a somewhat challenge. In terms of advancement, seems to be a limitation

company: BANK OF NEW YORK MELLON CORP
name_glassdoor: BANK OF NEW YORK MELLON CORP
review_title: Great place to start, but if you care about your career, don't get comfy here
review_info: Apr 19, 2022 - OTC Derivatives Specialist in Orlando, FL
pros: Great role to break your way into the world of finance. It is definitely what you make of it. You could use your time just to go through the motions, or you can use your time to sharpen other skills alongside and try to actively learn and network.
cons: The work can become very algorithmic and just button pushing when you get used to it. Pay is not worth the amount of work done. Work-life balance is terrible and there was no sign that there was going to be improvement.
advice: There is a severe need for automation. In addition, the tools and time to create them are difficult to get.  Position needs less finance majors, more people with programming skills. More pay as well.
